title: Israel Airstrike Targets Hamas Leaders in Qatar, Sparks International Criticism
snippets: The Israeli military says it carried out an airstrike in the capital of Qatar targeting senior leaders of Hamas, prompting strong criticism from the country that's been a key mediator.
Spokesperson for Qatar’s foreign ministry slams ‘criminal’ Israeli attack, condemns it 'in the strongest terms'.
The Israeli military says it attacked Hamas' leadership in Qatar's capital, Doha, where the militant group's political leaders and negotiators are based. Follow DW for more
The strike took place in Doha, according to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, which condemned the attack.
The U.S. Embassy in Doha issued a shelter-in-place order at its facilities in response to reports of the Israeli strike on Hamas leaders in the capital city.
Explosions heard as political leadership of Palestinian militant group targeted in Gulf state for first time
The Gulf nation of Qatar has been trying to negotiate a cease-fire in the conflict. The attack threatened to destabilize those peace efforts.
Hamas’ exiled leadership has long been based in Qatar, which has served as a mediator in talks between Hamas and Israel for several years.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMilgFBVV95cUxPT0Y0Zy1nS21zUVR0NkNwczEtYjZaUkhaWHhLQ3VPTlBYdWloaDFVTU1BTUlIcjBST2JTN2V0Ymozc2F6UHJpcTU2ZFpJNV9yZVllekZvY05NOWZfQzVVZE1pXzM1X1VqSWN3ZjVCQUFnbER1Qm9MRWlvSE02NkJpU1RuQjNTajhZQzNlSnJfX24yLVRPanc?oc=5" target="_blank">Israel Says It Conducted
Israel launched attack on Hamas leadership in Doha, the capital of Qatar.
titles: Israel says it targeted senior Hamas leaders in a strike in Qatar
Israeli military says it attacked Hamas leaders in Qatar’s Doha
Israeli military strikes Hamas leaders in Qatar
Israel conducts 'precise strike' on Hamas leadership in Qatar: Officials
Israel targets top Hamas officials in Qatar strike
Israel launches attack on Hamas in Qatar
Israel Targeted Hamas Leadership in Qatar Strike
Israel says it targeted Hamas leadership in Qatar, explosions heard in Doha
Israel Says It Conducted a ‘Precise Strike’ on Hamas Leadership - Bloomberg.com
Israeli military extends regional campaign with strike on Hamas in Qatar
summary: Israel conducted an airstrike in Doha, Qatar, targeting senior Hamas leaders, sparking criticism from Qatar, which condemned the attack as 'criminal' and a threat to peace efforts. The U.S. Embassy in Doha responded with a shelter-in-place order. This action marks a significant escalation, as Hamas' exiled leadership, involved in long-standing negotiations with Israel facilitated by Qatar, was targeted.

title: Nepal PM Resigns Amid Protests Over Social Media Ban and Corruption Allegations
snippets: Nepal's prime minister resigned Tuesday following violent protests against a ban on social media platforms and government corruption.
Nepal’s Prime Minister Khadga Prasad Sharma Oli has resigned, says his aide, after ministers quit over the mass
Protests continued in Kathmandu on Tuesday despite the lifting of a social media ban, with the houses of several senior politicians reportedly set on fire. Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli has resigned.

KP Sharma Oli resigns as police meet protests with deadly force, leaving 19 dead, and federal parliament is set alight

Nepal’s prime minister has resigned after some of the worst unrest in decades rocked the country this week, set off by a ban on social media and discontent at political co
K.P. Sharma Oli stepped down hours after a ban on social media was overturned, amid demonstrations dubbed “Gen Z protests” due to the youth of many participants.
The demonstrations in Nepal over government corruption and restrictions to apps such as WhatsApp and Facebook were driven by widespread anger among young people.
A day after violent clashes left at least 19 people dead, Prime Minister K.P. Sharma Oli and other ministers quit, with no clear path to assuaging young protesters in the capital.
As the protests against a social media ban in Nepal intensified, Prime Minister Khadga Prasad Oli said he was stepping down immediately.
Nepal has reversed its social media ban following nationwide “Gen Z” protests and public backlash.
titles: Nepal's prime minister resigns after protests against corruption and social media ban
Nepal prime minister resigns after mass protests and deaths
Nepal PM resigns as anti-corruption protests escalate
Nepal prime minister quits after deaths at protests sparked by social media ban
Nepal’s prime minister resigns after deadly protests over social media ban
At least 19 killed, hundreds injured in protests after Nepal social media ban
Nepal’s Prime Minister Resigns as Protesters Set Fire to Leaders’ Houses
Nepal prime minister resigns after 19 killed in protest crackdown
Nepal reverses social media ban as protests turn deadly
summary: Nepal's Prime Minister K.P. Sharma Oli resigned after widespread protests sparked by a social media ban and allegations of government corruption. The demonstrations, largely driven by the country's youth, continued even after the ban was lifted, leading to violent clashes that resulted in at least 19 deaths. The unrest, one of the worst in decades, also saw the federal parliament and the homes of several politicians set on fire. Oli's resignation came in the wake of his cabinet members quitting and no immediate solution to the crisis.

title: Record Downward Revision: U.S. Economy Added 911K Fewer Jobs in 2024-2025
snippets: U.S. added 911,000 fewer jobs than first estimated in 2024-2025, BLS says
The downward revision appears to be the largest ever recorded.
President Donald Trump criticized job reports featuring downward revisions in recent months.

The economy created 911,000 few jobs in the waning months of the Biden presidency and early stages of the Trump administration, indicating the labor market began to weaken much sooner than previously reported.
titles: U.S. added 911,000 fewer jobs than first estimated in 2024-2025, BLS says - Axios
US economy added 911,000 fewer jobs than previously reported
US Added Nearly A Million Fewer Jobs Than Reported
Economy created 911,000 fewer jobs in 2024-25 than reported. It’s more ammo for Fed rate cut.
summary: The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reported that the economy added 911,000 fewer jobs than initially estimated in 2024-2025, marking the largest downward revision on record. This correction indicates that the labor market began to weaken earlier than previously thought, during the late Biden presidency and into the Trump administration. President Trump has criticized recent job reports featuring such downward revisions.

title: Israeli Military Targets Hamas Leaders in Doha Strikes
snippets: The Israeli military said it carried out ‘targeted strikes’ on Hamas officials in Doha.
Israel has conducted a precise strike in Doha targeting senior Hamas leadership, according to separate statements from the Israel Defense Forces and Qatar's Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
The IDF said Tuesday that it carried out a strike targeting Hamas senior leadership. Qatar’s Foreign Ministry confirmed an attack on Hamas political leaders in Doha.
titles: Video: Explosions in Doha after Israel ‘targets Hamas’ leadership
WATCH:  Explosions in Qatar as IDF targets Hamas leadership
Live updates: Israel’s attack in Qatar targets senior Hamas leadership
summary: The Israeli military executed targeted strikes on senior Hamas officials in Doha, as confirmed by both the Israel Defense Forces and Qatar's Ministry of Foreign Affairs. These operations specifically aimed at the leadership of Hamas.

title: Flotilla Ship Hit by Drone in Tunisia, Mission to Gaza Continues
snippets: Activists on the Global Sumud Flotilla to Gaza say their main vessel was hit by a drone attack in Tunisia.
Global Sumud Flotilla shares video showing vessel being hit by flaming object at port, but says its mission will go ahead
The Global Sumud Flotilla planned to use the ship and others to bring humanitarian goods to Gaza.
titles: What we know about Gaza flotilla ‘drone attack’
Greta Thunberg flotilla says Gaza aid boat hit by drone attack in Tunisia
Gaza-Bound Flotilla Struck by Drone in Tunisia, Aid Group Says
summary: Activists from the Global Sumud Flotilla reported their main vessel was struck by a drone in Tunisia. A video shared by the group shows the ship being hit by a flaming object while docked. Despite the attack, the flotilla, which aims to deliver humanitarian goods to Gaza, affirmed their mission will proceed.

summary: Democrats on the House Oversight Committee published a photo of a birthday message allegedly signed by Donald Trump to Jeffrey Epstein, which Trump had previously denied existed. The White House and Trump's press secretary claim he did not create or sign the drawing. Following the Wall Street Journal's report on the letter, Trump sued the publication for $10 billion for defamation. The image was released after a subpoena was issued for information from Epstein's estate.

title: Ryan Staub Named Starting QB for Buffaloes Against Houston
snippets: The Colorado Buffaloes are expected to start Ryan Staub at quarterback for Friday's game at Houston, sources told ESPN.
Staub impressed in Colorado's Week 2 win against Delaware and earned a bigger opportunity
titles: Sources: Colorado expected to start Staub at QB
Colorado to start QB Ryan Staub in Week 3 Big 12 opener against Houston, per report
summary: Ryan Staub is set to start as quarterback for the Colorado Buffaloes in their upcoming game against Houston, following his noteworthy performance in the team's Week 2 victory over Delaware. This decision was reported by sources to ESPN.

title: Tyreek Hill's Estranged Wife Accuses Him of Domestic Violence in Divorce Filings
snippets: Tyreek Hill's estranged wife has alleged in court filings that he committed domestic violence, which the Dolphins receiver has vehemently denied.
Keeta Vaccaro alleged eight instances of domestic violence in court filings related to divorce proceedings
titles: Dolphins star Hill accused of domestic violence
Tyreek Hill accused of multiple instances of domestic violence in court filings by estranged wife
summary: Tyreek Hill's estranged wife, Keeta Vaccaro, has accused him of domestic violence in eight instances within divorce proceedings, according to court filings. Hill, a Dolphins receiver, has strongly denied these allegations.

title: J.J. McCarthy Leads Historic NFL Debut Comeback, Vikings Beat Bears 27-24
snippets: In thrilling fashion Monday night, Minnesota quarterback J.J. McCarthy authored a late comeback, becoming the first quarterback in NFL history to account for three touchdowns in the fourth quarter of his NFL debut, as the Vikings outlasted the Bears.
J.J. McCarthy struggled early, but his run game helped spur a come-from-behind win over the Bears.

J.J. McCarthy threw two fourth-quarter touchdown passes and ran for another in his long-awaited NFL debut, and the Minnesota Vikings rallied for a season-opening 27-24 win over the Chicago Bears on Monday night.
titles: McCarthy rallies Vikings in 4th quarter of debut
McCarthy, Vikings spoil Ben Johnson's Bears debut
J.J. McCarthy takes over late in debut as Vikings best Bears in opener
summary: In his NFL debut, J.J. McCarthy led a remarkable fourth-quarter comeback, scoring three touchdowns to secure a 27-24 victory for the Minnesota Vikings against the Chicago Bears. This made him the first quarterback in NFL history to achieve such a feat in his debut. The game, held at Soldier Field, saw the Bears lose a third-quarter lead in their first regular-season game under coach Ben Johnson, ending in a thrilling 27-24 win for the Vikings.

title: NFL Teams Inspired by Hunter's Dual-Role; Eye 2028 QB Prospect
snippets: There won't be another player like Hunter. But his play has inspired other teams to look for two-way stars.
An early look at a top-flight QB prospect in the 2028 NFL Draft class?
titles: Travis Hunter effect is alive in the 2025 college football season
10 college football transfers turning heads early in the 2025 season
summary: Hunter's unique two-way playing style has influenced other NFL teams to seek similar versatile players. Additionally, attention is turning towards a promising quarterback prospect for the 2028 NFL Draft.

title: U.S. Job Growth Revised Down by 900,000 in Latest Labor Report
snippets: The U.S. likely added 900,000 fewer jobs in the 12 months ending in March than had been reported, according to a preliminary Labor Department report.
Updated figures from Bureau of Labor Statistics are based on more comprehensive employment data
titles: BLS revision shows hiring was overstated by 911,000 jobs in past year
US hiring growth revised down by 911,000 jobs in year to March
summary: The U.S. added approximately 900,000 fewer jobs in the year ending in March than previously reported, based on a preliminary report from the Labor Department. This update comes from the Bureau of Labor Statistics, which utilized more comprehensive employment data for its revision.

The rankings provide a snapshot of team performance and momentum heading into the postseason.

title: Russia's Nightly Attacks on Ukraine Kill Hundreds, Zelensky Calls for Action
snippets: Since June, Russia has attacked Ukrainian cities nightly, launching at times hundreds of attack drones and dozens of missiles, and killing hundreds of civilians.
President Volodymyr Zelensky said that the strike on older people picking up their pensions should prompt a global response.
titles: Russia strikes eastern Ukraine village, killing 23, many retirees
Russian Bomb Hits Crowd of Retirees, Killing at Least 23, Ukraine Says
summary: Since June, Russia has launched nightly attacks on Ukrainian cities, using hundreds of drones and dozens of missiles, resulting in the deaths of hundreds of civilians. President Volodymyr Zelensky highlighted a strike on elderly individuals collecting pensions as necessitating a global response.

title: J.J. McCarthy Bounces Back from Tough NFL Debut, Earns Team Praise
snippets: J.J. McCarthy was not about to accept defeat. After looking like an overmatched rookie in his NFL regular-season debut and throwing a pick-six, he rose to the occasion.

Vikings Locker Room Went Nuts for J.J. McCarthy After Kevin O'Connell's Fiery Speech - Sports Illustrated
summary: J.J. McCarthy, after a challenging NFL debut where he threw a pick-six, significantly improved his performance. His resilience was celebrated in the Vikings' locker room, indicating a strong comeback and positive team support despite initial difficulties.

title: U.S. Informed Before Israel's Strike on Hamas in Qatar, Source Says
snippets: Israeli officials say US notified before attack, which Doha calls cowardly and a flagrant violation of international law

DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The U.S. had some forewarning that Israel intended to carry out the strike on Hamas in Qatar, according to a person familiar with the matter who was not authorized to comment publicly about the sensitive matter. Pentagon officials referred questions about coordinat
titles: Israel launches airstrikes against top Hamas members in Qatar for Gaza ceasefire talks
Israeli strike targets Hamas leaders in US-allied Qatar as they weigh Gaza ceasefire proposal
summary: The U.S. was informed before Israel conducted a strike on Hamas in Qatar, described by Doha as a cowardly act and a violation of international law. This information comes from a source familiar with the situation but not authorized to speak publicly. The Pentagon has not commented on the matter.

title: Johnson Criticized for Key Error Well Before Bears' Loss Finale
snippets: Johnson mismanaged the end of Chicago's Week 1 loss to the Vikings in more ways than one
Johnson is taking heat for what happened in the final two minutes of the Bears loss to the Vikings, but the real error came 20 minutes earlier.
titles: How Ben Johnson bungled the end of Bears coaching debut with timeout usage and kickoff decision
Bears' Ben Johnson stumbled in his head coaching debut, yes, but so did his players
summary: Johnson faced criticism for poor management during the final moments of the Bears' Week 1 loss to the Vikings. However, analysis suggests his significant mistake occurred 20 minutes before the game's conclusion. Critics are focusing on his decisions towards the end, but the earlier error had a more impactful role in the loss.

title: Jaguars Climb ESPN Power Rankings After Week 1 Victory
snippets: After a Week 1 win, where do the Jacksonville Jaguars now land in ESPN's latest power rankings?
B/R Experts' Week 2 NFL Power Rankings&

B/R Experts' Week 2 NFL Power Rankings - Bleacher Report
summary: Following their Week 1 win, the Jacksonville Jaguars have moved up in ESPN's latest power rankings. The team's performance has earned them a higher position in the rankings, reflecting their strong start to the season.

title: Russian Strike Kills 24 Civilians in Ukraine; Zelenskyy Seeks Stronger Response
snippets: 'The Russians continue to destroy lives but avoid new strong sanctions,' President Zelenskyy says.

A Russian strike killed at least 24 people as they collected pension payments in eastern Ukraine, prompting Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy to renew calls on the US and Western allies to respond to a spike in attacks on civilians.
titles: At least 21 civilians killed in Russian attack in eastern Ukraine’s Donetsk
Zelenskiy Says At Least 20 Killed in Russian Strike on Donetsk Town
summary: A Russian strike in eastern Ukraine killed at least 24 civilians at a pension payment collection point. Ukrainian President Zelenskyy has called on the US and Western allies for a stronger response to the increasing attacks on civilians, criticizing the lack of new, strong sanctions against Russia.

title: Macron to Appoint New PM After Government Collapse
snippets: CNBC takes a look at what could happen next in France after the ousting of yet another prime minister.
President Emmanuel Macron said he would appoint a new prime minister, the fifth in less than two years, after the government collapsed in a no-confidence vote.
titles: France's political crisis deepens as another PM is axed: Here's what happens next
France’s Political Crisis
summary: Following the collapse of the French government due to a no-confidence vote, President Emmanuel Macron announced plans to appoint a new prime minister, marking the fifth appointment in less than two years.

title: Perseverance Rover Explores Boulders Near Soroya Ridge on Mars
snippets: Last week, the Perseverance rover began an exciting new journey. Driving northwest of the Soroya ridge, Perseverance entered an area filled with a diverse range of boulders that the science team believes could hold clues to Mars's early history.

Written by By Henry Manelski, Ph.D. student at Purdue University Last week, the Perseverance rover began an exciting new journey. Driving northwest of the Soroya ridge, Perseverance entered an area filled with a diverse range of boulders that the science team believes could hold clues to Mars’ early
titles: Perseverance meets the megabreccia
Perseverance Meets the Megabreccia
summary: The Perseverance rover embarked on a new exploration northwest of the Soroya ridge last week, entering a region rich with diverse boulders. Scientists believe this area could reveal significant insights into Mars' early history.

title: Nepal Faces Turmoil as PM Resigns After Clashes and Protests
snippets: Nepal could face prolonged political and constitutional chaos unless there's an agreement to form a national unity government, say experts.

A day after violent clashes left at least 19 people dead, young demonstrators defied a curfew and targeted symbols of the governing elite. Prime Minister K.P. Sharma Oli and other ministers resigned as security chiefs pleaded for calm.
titles: What's next for Nepal after deadly protests force PM out?
Live Updates: Parliament Burns in Nepal as Protests Force Prime Minister to Quit
summary: In Nepal, experts warn of potential political and constitutional turmoil without a national unity government. Following violent clashes that killed 19, protesters breached a curfew, targeting the elite's symbols. Prime Minister K.P. Sharma Oli and ministers resigned amid calls for calm from security officials.

snippets: Pittsburgh adds another notable name to its secondary
Former North Jersey football star Jabrill Peppers has reportedly agreed to a deal with the Pittsburgh Steelers.

Report: Jabrill Peppers agrees to deal with Pittsburgh Steelers
summary: Pittsburgh adds another notable name to its secondary

Figures including Donald Trump, Bill Clinton and the UK ambassador to US, Peter Mandelson, apparently contributed

This document highlights the connections between Epstein and various high-profile individuals.

title: EU Lawmakers Pass Law to Cut Food Waste, Curb Fast Fashion Impact
snippets: EU lawmakers are set to give a final green light to a law on slashing the mountains of food wasted in Europe each year, and curbing the environmental impact of fast fashion.
EU lawmakers gave a final green light Tuesday to a law on slashing back the mountains of food wasted in Europe each year, and curbing the environmental impact of so-called fast fashion.
titles: EU to slash food and fast fashion waste
EU clamps down on food waste, fast fashion
summary: EU lawmakers approved a law aimed at significantly reducing food waste across Europe and minimizing the environmental impact of fast fashion. This legislation received its final endorsement on Tuesday, marking a major step towards more sustainable consumption practices within the EU.

titles: E. Jean Carroll's $83 million judgment against Trump upheld by appeals court - Axios
Trump loses bid to overturn $83.3 million judgment in E. Jean Carroll defamation case
summary: A federal appeals court upheld an $83.3 million judgment against former President Trump for defaming E. Jean Carroll, who accused him of rape. The court rejected Trump's immunity claim. With interest, the judgment exceeds $89 million.
